p:
Global warming is fastest in the Arctic, with a temperature increase more than twice the world’s average
15 . This has marked impacts on the arctic cryosphere: The central part of the Arctic Basin, where some areas have been permanently covered by multi-year sea ice for at least the last 5,500 years
16 , is supposed to become completely sea ice free each summer before the mid-21 st-century
15, 17 . Such a drastic habitat modification will have major consequences for large scale ocean circulation
18, 19 but also for Arctic Ocean acidity
20 and productivity
21, 22 , with impacts on ecological processes
23– 25 .
